[[File:Bundesarchiv Bild 101I-567-1503A-07, Gran Sasso, Mussolini mit deutschen FallschirmjÃ¤gern.jpg|thumb|right|Mussolini rescued by German troops from his prison in [[Campo Imperatore]] on September 12, 1943.]]
The '''Gran Sasso raid''' refers to '''Operation Eiche''' ([[German language|German]] for 'Oak'), the daring rescue of Italian dictator [[Benito Mussolini]] by [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[paratroopers]] in September 1943, during [[World War II]]. It was personally ordered by [[Adolf Hitler]], planned by Major [[Harald Mors]] and approved by General [[Kurt Student]].
The '''Gran Sasso raid''' refers to '''Operation Eiche''' ([[German language|German]] for 'Oak'), the daring rescue of Italian dictator [[Benito Mussolini]] by [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[paratroopers]] in September 1943, during [[World War II]]. It was personally ordered by [[Adolf Hitler]], planned by Major [[Harald Mors]] and approved by General [[Kurt Student]].
